revised_title: Molecular Chaperones: Chaperonins and Protein Folding Mechanisms
tldr: This article discusses the role of molecular chaperones, specifically chaperonins, in facilitating protein folding. Chaperonins form stable binary complexes with non-native protein states, preventing aggregation and arresting spontaneous folding. The release of target proteins in a state committed to the native state requires chaperonin-10 and ATP hydrolysis. The mechanisms of chaperonin-facilitated folding vary depending on the target protein, highlighting the complexity and unity of these processes.
